item.title: Bartle Taxonomy
item.description: 1996 paper by Richard Bartle focused on MMO players quadrant model: x axis is interacting with world vs interacting with players, y axis is acting on things unilaterally vs interacting with things

item.title: Gamer Motivations
item.description: Video games are meant to be just one thing. Fun. Fun for everyone! -Satoru Iwata Suppose you’re a game designer.

item.title: Ten Player Profiles
item.description: 10 player segments emerged when conducting a clustering analysis of the roughly 500,000 gamers who took the Gamer Motivation Profile survey conducted by Quantic Foundry.

item.title: Timmy, Johnny, and Spike
item.description: Mark Rosewater is an American game designer best known for being the head designer for the collectible card game Magic: The Gathering, a position he’s held since 2003.

item.title: Tokuro Fujiwara
item.description: Tokuro Fujiwara is a Japanese video game designer, active from about 1982 to 2009. He was involved in many formative Capcom titles as a director or producer.
